results.title: The Maple Leaf Forever
results.brief_description: On the 50th anniversary of the Battle of Queenstown Heights, October 1867, the people of Canada were invited by a newspaper in the capital to submit poetry songs to commemorate that historical event. This film recreates in live action an event in which a town schoolteacher was encouraged to enter a poem in the contest, he did so and the result became the popular Canadian song “The Maple Leaf Forever”.

results.title: The Many faces of Taiwan
results.creator_credit: Lee Dong-Ming, Yeng Chung-Fan and Keta Communications
results.brief_description: A documentary revealing the true spirit of Taiwan. It takes the audience on an exciting excursion to six major scenic and cultural spots in Taiwan including a visit to Orchid Island, participating in the age-old aboriginal rites of the Yami tribe and Taiwan’s natural wonder, Taroko Gorge. We also visit the ancient city of Tainan, bustling Kaohsiung city, and the country’s largest city Taipei. In addition to being an exciting visual experience, it is also a musical treat, with scores written especially by composer Gerald Shih.

results.title: The Manufacture of gas
results.brief_description: A description of gas manufacture showing all stages from the raw material, coal, to the storage of finished product in gas-holders. Shows also the extraction of by-products such as coke, tar, benzol, dyes and disinfectants. The film stresses the economy of gas manufacture compared with the burning of coal in fireplaces or the generation of electricity using coal as raw material.

results.title: The Man from East Liverpool: Ben Feldman
results.creator_credit: Jay J. Sheridan and Jay J Sheridan and Company
results.brief_description: Instructional film on salesmanship and setting goals for yourself. Uses Insurance salesman Ben Feldman as the focus. He gives a background of himself and how he got to where he is today. He is shown in action conducting sales in real scenarios demonstrating the attitudes needed to achieve personal success.

results.title: The Man and the snake
results.creator_credit: Sture Rydman, Elizabeth McKay and Jocelyn Films
results.brief_description: Presents a story of a young man’s visit to the home of a zoologist who keeps and studies snakes. Based on the story of the same title by ambrose Bierce. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Making of the river [B&W]
results.brief_description: Shows how a river forms from many sources: the clouds, melting snow in the mountains and underground springs. It flows throufh canyons and forests, making waterfalls and sometimes quiet pools. Also shows plant and animal life it passes on the journey to the sea, gathering water from joining streams.

results.title: The Magic machines & other tricks
results.creator_credit: Bob Curtis, Joan Keller Stern and Fly-By-Night Productions
results.brief_description: The work of Robert Gilbert, sculptor, we hear his voice as the camera examines his work, his tools and the leftover junk and objects which he assembles into his colourful kinetic sculpture. We see the work displayed in various places - on a truck riding along the freeway - in an elevator and in one painful sequence at Century Plaza, Los Angeles where we see “MACHINE JUNE 23”, work which commemorates the brutal confrontation between police and demonstrators on that day.
